Agent and Environment

Agent and Environment are all defined in Melodie.boost for better performance, and you may find it will only jump to a .pyi file if you are trying to jump into the code. If you would like to view the source code, please visit our git repository. The path to related files are listed below:

  • Stub File: Melodie/boost/basics.pyi

  • Source Code: Melodie/boost/basics.pyx

  • Cython Interface: Melodie/boost/basics.pxd

class Melodie.boost.basics.Agent

Bases: Melodie.boost.basics.Element

id
model
scenario
set_params(params)

As Agent.id is a Cython-compiled property, it cannot be modified by setattr() function. So this method is for overcoming this problem.

Parameters

params – None

Returns

setup()

This is the initialization method, declare properties here.

Here, “Declare” is to define properties with an initial value, such as:

1class NewAgent(Agent)
2    def setup(self):
3        self.int_property = 0  # int property
4        self.float_property = 0.0  # float property
5        self.str_property = ""  # string property

It is also fine to define properties with complex data structure such as dict/list/set, but the values in the complex data structure is hard to be recorded by the DataCollector

This method is executed at the end of the __init__ method of the corresponding agent container.

Returns

class Melodie.boost.basics.Element

Bases: object

set_params(params)
Parameters

params – Dict[str, Any]

Returns

class Melodie.boost.basics.Environment

Bases: Melodie.boost.basics.Element

model
scenario
setup()

The setup method of the environment.

Use self.scenario to get the parameters from the scenario.

Returns

to_dataframe(properties: List[str])

Dump Environment to a one-row pd.DataFrame

Parameters

properties –

Returns

to_dict(properties)

Dump Environment to a plain dict.

Parameters

properties – List[str]

Returns

Just include class Agent inside doc and undoc the Agent.id and Agent.model
